meanings.definition: To reshape or redefine the outline or shape of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to recontour her garden by moving the plants around.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a chisel to carefully recontour the marble sculpture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to recontour a balloon animal is like trying to catch a slippery fish.
meanings.sent4: Her smile recontoured her face, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds recontoured the sand dunes along the beach.
meanings.sent6: After the earthquake, the landscape had been recontoured by the shifting tectonic plates.

meanings.definition: The act of altering the contour or shape of something.
meanings.sent1: The recontour of the mountain was evident after the landslide.
meanings.sent2: The recontour of the dress made it more flattering on her figure.
meanings.sent3: The recontour of the cake made it look like a whimsical castle.
meanings.sent4: The recontour of the city skyline was breathtaking at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The recontour of the clouds painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
meanings.sent6: The recontour of the coastline was a result of years of erosion and deposition.
